intro: Micromeles yongdeensis, commonly known as the Yongde honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and is adapted to cooler climates. Its leaves are simple and opposite, with a rough texture. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
